element.label: Explanation of Benefit Institutional Base Resource for IDR. Ignore in DD Generation
element.definition: ExplanationOfBenefit-Institutional-Base definition

element.label: Claim Non Payment Reason Code
element.definition: The reason that no Medicare payment is made for services on an institutional claim.

element.label: Lifetime Reserved Days Used Count
element.definition: The number of lifetime reserve days that the beneficiary has elected to use during the period covered by the institutional claim.

element.label: Total Coinsurance Days Count
element.definition: The count of the total number of coinsurance days involved with the beneficiary's stay in a facility.

element.label: Non Utilization Day Count
element.definition: On an institutional claim, the number of days of care that are not chargeable to Medicare facility utilization.

element.label: Pass Through Per Diem Amount
element.definition: Medicare establishes a daily payment amount to reimburse IPPS hospitals for certain “pass-through” expenses, such as capital-related costs, direct medical education costs, kidney acquisition costs for hospitals that are renal transplant centers, and bad debts. This variable is the daily payment rate for pass-through expenses.

element.label: Utilization Day Count
element.definition: On an institutional claim, the number of covered days of care that are chargeable to Medicare facility utilization that includes full days, coinsurance days, and lifetime reserve days. It excludes any days classified as non-covered, leave of absence days, and the day of discharge or death.

element.label: Claim PPS Capital DRG Weight Number
element.definition: The number used to determine a transfer adjusted case mix index for capital, under the prospective payment system (PPS). The number is determined by multiplying the Diagnosis Related Group Code (DRG) weight times the discharge fraction.

element.label: Claim PPS Capital Disproportionate Share Amount
element.definition: The amount of disproportionate share (rate reflecting indigent population served) portion of the PPS payment for capital.

element.label: Claim PPS Capital Exception Amount
element.definition: The capital PPS amount of exception payments provided for hospitals with inordinately high levels of capital obligations. Exception payments expire at the end of the 10-year transition period.

element.label: Claim PPS Capital FSP Amount
element.definition: The amount of the federal specific portion of the PPS payment for capital.

element.label: Claim PPS Capital IME Amount
element.definition: The amount of the indirect medical education (IME) (reimbursable amount for teaching hospitals only; an added amount passed by Congress to augment normal prospective payment system [PPS] payments for teaching hospitals to compensate them for higher patient costs resulting from medical education programs for interns and residents) portion of the PPS payment for capital.

element.label: Claim PPS Capital Outlier Amount
element.definition: The amount of the outlier portion of the PPS payment for capital.

element.label: Claim PPS Old Capital Hold Harmless Amount
element.definition: This amount is the hold harmless amount payable for old capital as computed by PRICER for providers with a payment code equal to 'A'.

element.label: Claim Total PPS Capital Amount
element.definition: The total amount that is payable for capital for the prospective payment system (PPS) claim.

element.label: Primary Payer Paid Amount
element.definition: The amount of a payment made on behalf of a Medicare beneficiary by a primary payer other than Medicare, that the provider is applying to covered Medicare charges on a non-institutional claim.

element.label: Professional Component Charge
element.definition: This field is the amount of physician and other professional charges covered under Medicare Part B.

element.label: DRG Outlier Approved Payment Amount
element.definition: On an institutional claim, the additional payment amount approved by the Quality Improvement Organization due to an outlier situation for a beneficiary's stay under the prospective payment system (PPS), which has been classified into a specific diagnosis related group (DRG).

element.label: Deductible Amount
element.definition: The amount of the deductible the beneficiary paid for inpatient services, as originally submitted on the institutional claim.

element.label: Claim Uncompensated Care Payment Amount
element.definition: This field identifies the payment for disproportionate share hospitals (DSH). It represents the uncompensated care amount of the payment

element.label: FI Claim Action Code
element.definition: The type of action requested by the intermediary to be taken on an institutional claim.

element.label: Blood Deductible Liability Amount
element.definition: The amount of money for which the intermediary determined the beneficiary is liable for the blood deductible.

element.label: Noncovered Charge Amount
element.definition: The non-covered charges for all accommodations and services, reported on an inpatient claim (used for internal NCHMQA editing purposes).
